subject: Re: [junit] I would like to fix JUnit bugs.What should I do?
msgSnippet: ... I see. There really isn t. JUnit isn t as open source as you d expect. That s a good thing, though, otherwise JUnit would be massive and no-one would want
messageBody:
Narendra S wrote:

> I have not found any bugs but I have noticed that there are a list of
> problems reported by many junit users and also feature requests(like
> inclusion of new methods) in sourceforge.net.
> Some problems have been accepted as bugs and fixed by Mr. Erich Gamma while
> other problems(probably they are not problems) have not been "assigned to"
> anybody.
> So I thought there was a procedure for getting bugs assigned.

I see. There really isn't. JUnit isn't as open source as you'd expect.
That's a good thing, though, otherwise JUnit would be massive and no-one
would want to use it.

My suggestion is to look for extensions to JUnit and see whether they
support what you need. If not, join one of those projects.

Take care.
--
J. B. Rainsberger,
Diaspar Software Services
http://www.diasparsoftware.com :: +1 416 791-8603
Let's write software that people understand
